messages.messageBody:
Julie,
What a hoot! Thanks for the smiles this morning. ;-)


Barb E
"By learning to be with myself, to bring peace to myself,
I can be more effective both in creating happiness in my
own life and in offering a helping hand to others."

- Ingrid Bacci, Author

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 940
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Julie.  Oh have I ever been there!  Only with me it was my fil!  I never got up the courage to call him back and thank goodness, he acted like it never
messages.messageBody:
Hi Julie. Oh have I ever been there! Only with me it was my fil! I never got
up the courage to call him back and thank goodness, he acted like it never
happened. I think he may have been more embarrassed than me. HeidiC.

Julie Solich wrote:

> >>It is the same as how whenever a mom with young children lies down and is
> completely horizontal a child cries and how whenever she sits on the toilet
> the
> phone rings. Never fails... HeidiC<<
>
> Hi, been reading for awhile, haven't posted yet. I read this and had a
> memory flash. Have to share.
> I was on the toilet and... the phone rang. My son who was then 3 decided he
> would answer it. I called out not to bother but I heard him dragging a chair
> across the room towards the phone. I sat there helplessly and listened to
> him answer the phone and tell the person that "Mummy can't come to the phone
> coz she's doing a poo!" Aagghh!!!!! He came in a few minutes later to tell
> me it was Noni (my mum). I called her when I could and she answered the
> phone crying from laughter. Phew!
>
> I'm Julie by the way, mum to three amazing kids. I'm in Australia.
>

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 940
messages.msgSnippet: ... completely horizontal a child cries and how whenever she sits on the toilet the phone rings.  Never fails...  HeidiC
messages.messageBody:
>>It is the same as how whenever a mom with young children lies down and is
completely horizontal a child cries and how whenever she sits on the toilet
the
phone rings. Never fails... HeidiC<<


Hi, been reading for awhile, haven't posted yet. I read this and had a
memory flash. Have to share.
I was on the toilet and... the phone rang. My son who was then 3 decided he
would answer it. I called out not to bother but I heard him dragging a chair
across the room towards the phone. I sat there helplessly and listened to
him answer the phone and tell the person that "Mummy can't come to the phone
coz she's doing a poo!" Aagghh!!!!! He came in a few minutes later to tell
me it was Noni (my mum). I called her when I could and she answered the
phone crying from laughter. Phew!

I'm Julie by the way, mum to three amazing kids. I'm in Australia.
